channel.title: CVE Feed for Symantec Corporation -- Symantec Encryption Desktop
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Symantec Corporation -- Symantec Encryption Desktop

item.title: CVE-2017-13682|2024-08-05T19:05:19.111Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20encryption%20desktop
item.description: In Symantec Encryption Desktop before SED 10.4.1 MP2HF1, a kernel memory leak is a type of resource leak that can occur when a computer program incorrectly manages memory allocations in such a way that memory which is no longer needed is not released. In object-oriented programming, a memory leak may happen when an object is stored in memory but cannot be accessed by the running code.

item.title: CVE-2017-6330|2024-08-05T15:25:49.142Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20encryption%20desktop
item.description: Symantec Encryption Desktop before SED 10.4.1MP2 can allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via crafted web requests."
